passages.name: Cut off
passages.text: <<display 'Look out below'>>

passages.name: Sarah
passages.text:
"My wife, Sarah." He says as he points to a photo of a woman. He silently stares at it for a few moments. "The horse is named Henry. We had another one called Susan, too. She loved those horses, even made wigs from their hair when she had enough from trimming ‘em."

He pauses to drink some more of his tea. "I'll be the first to admit she was an odd one, but I loved that woman. She made me happier than I thought possible. Not a day goes by where I don't miss 'er."

<<set $sarah = 2>><<display 'Time to talk'>>

passages.name: There's a light
passages.text:
You struggle towards the light with all your remaining strength.

It's emitting from a house.

You slam open the door and collapse inside, the world fading around you.

[[...|Wake]]

passages.name: Dress to impress
passages.text:
You find and iron your most trusted outfit and slip it on. You take a gander at yourself in the mirror and feel confident, until you remember that you're running late.

This is no time for self-appreciation!<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 5>><<set $dressedWell = 1>>

<<display 'Rumbly tummy'>>

passages.name: Explain
passages.text:
You explain your dire situation to the old man, who reveals his name to be John.

<<if $axeAsk = 0>>"Alright," he says with a sniff. "The storm knocked out the phone line. The weather's died down enough that the CB Radio in my truck might work."<<endif>><<if $axeAsk = 1>> <<endif>>"Alright," he says with a sniff. "As for the axe, I was out choppin’ firewood. I'm not sure if you've noticed, but it's bloody cold.

"The storm knocked out the phone line. The weather's died down enough that the CB Radio in my truck might work."<<endif>>

He opens the door you crashed through earlier, and before closing it behind him, looks you in the eye and says "Stay right there. And don't touch anything."<<set $returnVar = 0>>

<<display 'Kitchen'>>

passages.name: Drinking tea together
passages.text: You drink from your mug while keeping an eye on the man opposite you.\n\n<<display 'He drinks'>>

passages.name: Your goose is cooked!
passages.text:
You quickly dive to the floor, knocking over the standee in the process. The man stares at it with menace in his eyes, and snarls "You." He points the gun at the standee and fires. The bullet goes straight through the cardboard and into you. You spend your last few moments on Earth lying there, shot through the heart, by the image of Jon Bon Jovi.

THE END

[[What if you had done things differently?|Outside the karaoke bar]] [[What if you had been bestowed a different fate?|The beginning]]

What if you had been bestowed a different fate?

passages.name: Leap
passages.text:
Your attempt to leap over Sarah's desk is foiled by your own foot getting caught on the ledge, sending you face first onto the floor, scattering papers in all directions in the process. You quickly stand up and dust yourself off.

"Sorry, Sarah."

"You're insane," she replies, doing a bad job of hiding her irritation as she gathers up the papers. "Just get to the meeting."

<<display 'Meeting'>>

passages.text: <<if $oldAge eq 1 AND $lookingUp eq 1 AND $jovi eq 1>><<set $oldAge = 0>><<set $lookingUp = 0>><<set $jovi = 0>><<endif>><<if $firstDeathGiven eq 1>><<if $oldAge neq 0 AND $lookingUp neq 0 AND $jovi eq 0>><<display 'SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI'>><<endif>><<if $oldAge neq 0 AND $lookingUp eq 0>><<display 'LOOKING UP'>><<endif>><<if $oldAge eq 0>><<display 'OLD AGE'>><<endif>><<endif>><<if $firstDeathGiven eq 0>><<set $firstDeathGiven = 1>><<set $firstDeath = Math.floor(Math.random()*3+1)>><<if $firstDeath eq 1>><<display 'LOOKING UP'>><<endif>><<if $firstDeath eq 2>><<display 'OLD AGE'>><<endif>><<if $firstDeath eq 3>><<display 'SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI'>><<endif>><<endif>>\n\n

destination.name: SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI

passages.name: Look out below
passages.text:
As you move forward, the people surrounding you suddenly look up with terror in their faces, and flee the street.

[[Look up.|Whew!]]
[[Ignore the alarm of others and continue moving forward.|Splat]]

links.text: Ignore the alarm of others and continue moving forward.

passages.name: Beneath
passages.text:
<<set $lookCloth = 1>>You lift the table cloth up and peek under it. You see what are clearly blood stains, smudged as if someone attempted to remove them with little success.

You put the cloth back down.

<<display 'Kitchen'>>

passages.name: Wigs
passages.text: You walk over to the pair of wigs, each sitting on a stand. One is [[blonde|Blonde]] and the other is [[brunette|Brunette]].

passages.name: Your move!
passages.text:
He grabs the nearest chair and starts flailing it wildly around! "Turn the music off!" he screams. "I'm not ready yet!"

[[Use Bon Jovi as a shield!|Knocked his block off!]]
[[Duck! DUCK!|Goose!]]
[[Try to knock the chair from his hands!|Knock, knock!]]

links.text: Use Bon Jovi as a shield!
Try to knock the chair from his hands!

passages.name: What a rotten way to die
passages.text:
Suddenly, John begins to choke. He slams his hands on the desk as the choking becomes more violent and he begins to struggle, knocking over his mug in the process, the coffee spilling all over the table cloth which it proceeds to burn straight through. "What the hell did you do t-," John’s sentence is interrupted by a stream of vomit erupting from his mouth. He lunges at you and wraps his hands around your neck before collapsing to the floor. The Rescue Services burst through the front door, stopping in their tracks as they see the lifeless body on the floor before looking at you. You may be locked away for some time.

THE END

[[What if you had done things differently?|A cold kitchen]] [[What if you had been bestowed a different fate?|The beginning]]

links.text: What if you had done things differently?
What if you had been bestowed a different fate?

passages.name: Closet
passages.text: You search through the closest and find nothing but old clothes and some fishing gear.\n\n<<display 'Bedroom'>>

passages.name: Watch
passages.text:
<<if $chatted eq 0>>You stand back and watch others approach the machine. A male who looks to be in his mid-to-late twenties approaches the machine, shaking. 

He inserts a coin, has his finger jabbed, and picks up the ticket that's printed shortly afterwards. With reluctance, he reads it and a wave of relief rolls across his body. He wipes sweat from his brow and walks away, still a little shaken, but not stirred.

"Doing a bit of deathspotting, huh?" You turn around and see a young woman, maybe not even quite in her twenties, with azure blue hair and red rimmed glasses, and sporting a simple, black work uniform.

[[Deathspotting?|Ask]]
[[Yeah.|Yes]]
[[Nah.|No]]<<endif>><<if $chatted eq 1>>
You stand back and wait for others to approach the machine, but it appears the death rush is over. No one comes.

[[Return your eyes to the mall.|Standing in a mall]]<<endif>>

links.text: Return your eyes to the mall.

passages.name: SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI
passages.text:
You insert your finger, wince slightly at the jab, then pick up and read the card that’s quickly spat out.

SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI

YEARS LATER...

You finally arrive at Rachel's house, a two-story villa overlooking the beach. Well, it actually belongs to her father, but he lets her have this one since he has another three dotted along the coast. Rachel is what some people call a "trust fund kid." Despite her wealth, she still has a job, which is how you met her. Your desk is across from hers. Some of your other co-workers warned you about her, describing her as a bit of a wild one. But "weird" and "crazy" are often words boring people use to describe interesting ones. But hey, she invited you out with some of her friends, and you could do with a fun night out. It's been far too long since the last one. You pull up into the drive way and approach the front door. [[Knock.|In da house]]<><><><><><><><>

passages.name: Knock, knock!
passages.text:
You slam your entire weight against the man, making him stumble backwards and drop the chair to the ground as a group of patrons race to restrain him.

<<display 'Outta here'>>

passages.name: Tackle
passages.text:
You launch yourself at Jon Bon Jovi and tackle him to the ground! It's at this point you realise that it's only a cardboard standee. You stand up and look around. Everyone is silently staring at you with wide eyes.

"Uh, haha, my friend is a really huge fan of Jovi!” Rachel nervously explains. "Just had to hug him!" An "Ooh!" sweeps over the crowd and they return to their merry ways.

"What the hell was that?" asks Rachel, clearly trying to restrain anger.

[[Tell her about your death.|Reveal to Rachel]]
[[Apologise and sit down at a table with her.|Sit on it]]

links.text: Apologise and sit down at a table with her.

passages.name: StoryTitle
passages.text: Machine of Death

passages.name: Wait
passages.text:
<<if $carWait eq 0>>You sit in the car and wait patiently. Snow continues to storm outside with no signs of stopping soon.<<endif>><<if $carWait eq 1>>You spend more time sitting in the car and waiting patiently. The snow storm carries on outside with no signs of relenting.<<endif>><<set $carWait = 1>>

[[Wait.|Wait]]
[[Try using your mobile phone.|Phone]]
[[Try starting the car.|Ignition]]
[[Go outside.|Outside]]

passages.name: Shoot
passages.text:
You pull the gun from the back of your pants, aim between Jon Bon Jovi's eyes, and pull the trigger. A bullseye. Jovi falls against the wall. Strangely, his expression doesn't seem to change at all. By the time you realise it was only a cardboard standee, you've already been tackled to the ground by several patrons. Eventually you're escorted into the back of a police car as Rachel looks on in horror. You better start livin’ on a prayer about getting off lightly.

THE END

[[What if you had done things differently?|Outside the karaoke bar]] [[What if you had been bestowed a different fate?|The beginning]]

links.text: What if you had done things differently?
What if you had been bestowed a different fate?

passages.name: Bar
passages.text:
You get out of your car and enter the bar with Rachel. The sound of a trio of women singing a drunken rendition of Wannabe by the Spice Girls hits you like a brick in the face.

After the initial aural shock wears off, you look around and examine your surroundings. It is quite possibly the tackiest bar you've ever been in. There's low lighting, pictures of famous singers cover the wall, Christmas lights arranged into flower and love heart shapes hang from the ceiling, and it's a little sticky where you're standing.

That said, it doesn't appear to be the dangerous, scum-dwelling establishment its exterior suggests. It’s full of joyous people drinking, swaying and singing.

You take a moment to relish the drunken merriment. Then, in a corner, you see rock idol Jon Bon Jovi.

<<if $gun eq 1>>[[Shoot him before he has the chance to strike!|Shoot]]<html></br></html><<endif>>[[Tackle him to the ground!|Tackle]]
[[Duck! DUCK!|Duck]]
[[Ignore him.|Ignore]]

links.text: Shoot him before he has the chance to strike!

passages.name: Eating a sinner
passages.text:
Some consider the sandwich a form of self inflicted punishment to atone for past sins. Others believe it's a delicious delicacy.

You're not sure which camp you fall in, but are ever so slightly leaning towards the former.
<<set $coins = $coins - 2>>

if you quit, you end up going to someone you look up to but they cant you into a lot of trouble

someone knocks you off with their scooter, its tempting to chase after her and boot her off her scooter, but you must stay focused

add a little bit of random chance to the quest

passages.name: Gone home
passages.text:
You begin the long walk back home. On the way, you walk past the sign that almost ended your life, now partly responsible for prompting you to change it. "Things are looking up!" You can't help but smile.

THE END

passages.name: Thanks

"I thought so, considering your hands." You look down at them and realise they're shaking.

<<display 'On the beach'>>

passages.name: Leave
passages.text:
You take one last look at the machine and decide that, at least for today, you’re content with not adding the knowledge of your inevitable demise to your purchases. Fate can wait.

THE END

<<set $alleyRandom = 0>><<set $alleyRandom = Math.floor(Math.random()*2+1)>><<if $alleyRandom eq 1>><<set $timePassed = $timePassed - 2>>You dash down the alley. Brilliant! There's no loading truck! You slowly navigate around it, recieve odd looks from the delivery people, and move down to the next street.<<endif>>

<<if $timePassed lte 25>>You let out a sigh of relief when you come out to the street and see the bus coming towards you. You hope on, and it eventually drops you off outside the office.

<<display 'Something foyer'>><<else>>You emerge from the street only to see the bus driving off in the distance. You were too slow! 

You could dash down to a main street while looking up the number of a taxi company in your phone, and arrange for someone to drive you to the building. Or just forget about it and move on with your life.

<<display 'A message'>>

passages.name: Outside the karaoke bar
passages.text:
You drive past a billboard advertising the latest Machine of Death. Some clever graffiti makes it read "Death to the Machine of Death." It looks like you've wandered into one of THOSE neighbourhoods.

You eventually arrive at the bar, which appears to be the kind of questionable repute. Half the lights of its neon name tag aren't functioning, the bin outside is overflowing, and a row of motorcycles are lined up next to it.

"I've no idea what I'm going to sing first," Rachel excitedly mutters to no one in particular as she hurries out of the car and towards the bar’s entrance.

You almost impulsively dash after her, when you suddenly remember something. In your glove box is a gun<<if $win eq 1>> (currently being safely guarded by your Wee Rex Adorable Plush<<endif>>, which you keep handy for all potential Bon Jovi related emergencies.

[[Take the gun.|Gun]]
[[Leave the gun.|Gunless]]

passages.name: Eat eat eat
passages.text:
You throw money at the vendor, which frankly is a rather rude thing to do, and order a tofu dog topped with mango chutney.<<set $ateFood = 1>>

[[No time to lose! Jam it in your mouth! (Two minutes)|Sloppy eater]]
[[Just because you're in a hurry doesn't mean you have to lose your dignity! Eat it carefully! (Three minutes)|Stealth eater]]

Just because you're in a hurry doesn't mean you have to lose your dignity! Eat it carefully! (Three minutes)

passages.name: Photo
passages.text: You look at the photo on the bedside table. It shows what appears to be a young couple on their wedding day. The kind of wedding from a different era, say, fifty or so years ago.\n\n<<display 'Bedroom'>>

passages.name: The hard truth
passages.text:
Shock shatters the miniature rock star's face before it’s quickly replaced with anger. "That sort of talk isn't going to help my recovery at all! You're bad medicine. And bad medicine is not what I need."

He gives you a little growl, then walks over to his bed, curls up, and sends you the cutest death stare before falling asleep, moments before Rachel bounds down the stairs with her usual energy.

<<display 'Time to go'>>

You sprint after the bus, but it just feels like it keeps slipping further away!<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 1>>

passages.text:
You grab the gun and try to wrestle it from the man's hands, only to hear a loud BANG before you fall backwards into the standee and onto the floor. You spend your last few moments on Earth lying there, shot through the heart, by the image of Jon Bon Jovi.

THE END

The bullet goes straight through the cardboard and into you. You fall to the ground. You spend your last few moments on Earth lying there, shot through the heart, by the image of Jon Bon Jovi.

passages.text: You decided that you don't need a firearm. You already have a set of guns sitting below your shoulders, after all.<<set $gun = 0>>\n\n<<display 'Bar'>>

passages.name: From my cold, dead hands
passages.text:
You safely stow the gun in your jacket. You hear the scampering of little feet behind you and turn to see Bon Jovi joyously run to the shore, playfully running towards and away from the waves as they move in and out before he comes up to you. "Hello, Bon Jovi," you say. "Hello!" he responds. You crouch down and give him a pat, only for your gun to fall from your jacket and onto the sand. Before you get a chance to pick it up, Bon Jovi picks it up in his mouth. "Lookth what I foundth!" he excitedly exclaims before a loud bang rings out across the beach. "Oopth," you hear Bon Jovi say as the world fades around you.

THE END

Well, this is a rather unfortunate situation. Not life threatening - at least, not to you - but tedious nonetheless. Still, better try find a way out of this predicament.<<endif>><<if $car eq 1>>You get back in the car, still stuck in a pickle.<<endif>>

passages.name: On the beach
passages.text:
You wander down to the beach with Rachel. It's a serene scene, with the moonlight shimmering on the ocean, the waves gently lapping the sand.

"At least we'll have a story to tell at work, I guess," Rachel suggests.

[[“What do you see in a place like that?”|Why the dive?]]
[[“Is this how all your nights end up?”|Nights]]

links.text: “What do you see in a place like that?”
“Is this how all your nights end up?”

passages.name: Shoo
passages.text:
Shock shatters the miniature rock star's face before it’s quickly replaced with hurt. You almost feel like apologising, but before you can, Bon Jovi stares you straight in the eyes and says "Don't. The damage is done."

With his head lowered, he slowly trundles off to his bed, curls up, and gives you puppy dog eyes before falling asleep, moments before Rachel bounds down the stairs with her usual energy.

<<display 'Time to go'>>

passages.text:

The Lister sandwich. Take one slice of bread. Throw a fried egg on it and smother it with fruit chutney. Stack on another piece of bread and throw a fried egg on top, this time smothered in chilli sauce. Seal the deal with a final slice of bread.

Once everyone leaves the room, you approach David and show him your card.

David scoffs. "Do you know what my death card says? Poison!" he yells, not even giving you a chance to guess. "Do you know what that means?"

[["Your penchant for oysters is going to turn sour?"|Meaning]]
[["You're going to be poisoned by a disgruntled employee?"|Meaning]]
[["You're going to get hit by Poison's tour bus?"|Meaning]]

It's a death card.

passages.text: You stand in the middle of the room and wait.\n\n<<display 'The meeting'>>

passages.name: Axe to grind
passages.text:
<<set $axeAsk = 1>> He seems taken aback by the implied accusation. "No," he replies, his voice as cold as the snow outside. "First you tell me what the devil you're doing in ‘ere."

[[Explain your situation.|Explain]]

passages.name: In da house
passages.text:
Before you even finish knocking, Rachel almost rips the door from its hinges.  "Hey, come in!" she excitedly shrills, her blonde hair dancing on her shoulders, where they meet the top of a long, understated black dress. You greet and follow her into the lounge room, which is about the size of a restaurant. A large restaurant. It's complete with a bar and ludicrously large entertainment system.

She gestures about the room as she hastily walks towards the stairs. "Sit wherever you like!" she insists.

[[Sit on a sofa.|Sofahh]]
[[Sit on a barstool.|Making a stool of yourself]]
[[Remain standing.|Standing your ground]]

passages.name: Drink up
passages.text: You lift the warm mug to your lips and take a small sip of hot tea.\n\n<<display 'Time to talk'>>

passages.name: The choice
passages.text:
As she walks off, you feel the weight of the gun press against you.

You think about that crazed man at the bar, and how easily it could have been you. People call Rachel the crazy one, but you're the one carrying a gun around in case you bump into members of Bon Jovi!

[[It's time to let it go. Dismantle the gun to the best of your ability and get rid of it.|Dismantle and dispose]]
[[Things could have gone a lot worse tonight. Who knows when I'll need that gun to survive!|From my cold, dead hands]]

links.text: It's time to let it go. Dismantle the gun to the best of your ability and get rid of it.
Things could have gone a lot worse tonight. Who knows when I'll need that gun to survive!

passages.name: See no evil
passages.text:
You quickly grab the gun, stash it in your jacket, and close the glove box.

<<display 'The drive home'>>

passages.name: Losing smile
passages.text:
You squeeze some toothpaste into your mouth and combine it with water, swivel the mixture around for a bit, then spit it out.

Well, that should take care of your breath. You'll just have to remember not to smile too much.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 1>><<set $brushedTeeth = 0>>

<<display 'Dressing time'>>

passages.name: Rescue
passages.text:
You hear a knock at the door. John gets up to open it and welcomes in a couple of rescue workers. They bring some equipment over to check your well-being and lend you some crutches to help you get around. Before you leave, you turn around to thank John but he's nowhere to be seen. Then he walks out of the bedroom, carrying some fishing gear. He looks over to you and nods. "Nice to meet ya. Hope you have a good life."

THE END

[[What if you had done things differently?|A cold kitchen]] [[What if you had been bestowed a different fate?|The beginning]]

links.text: What if you had done things differently?
What if you had been bestowed a different fate?

passages.name: So clean
passages.text:
You give your body the scrub down it so desperately needs, running a flannel over every bump and diving deep into every crevice, and eventually emerge from the shower minty fresh.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 8>><<set $showered = 1>>

<<display 'Teeth'>>

passages.name: Eating a floater
passages.text:
And now you understand why it's advised to eat them while drunk. At least the peas had some nutrients, making it the closest thing Deady's have to a healthy meal.
<<set $coins = $coins - 4>>

[[Return your eyes to the mall.|Standing in a mall]]

links.text: Return your eyes to the mall.

passages.name: Eating a lister
passages.text:
The trick to a Lister Sandwich is to eat it before the bread disintergrates. It makes you feel like you're having a baby.<<set $coins = $coins - 2>>

[[Return your eyes to the mall.|Standing in a mall]]

links.text: Return your eyes to the mall.

passages.name: Explore
passages.text:
You head out and trudge through the snow, trying to find some immediate assistance. After a short while, you turn around and see you've already lost sight of your car, your tracks leading back covered by snow.

"Hmm," you think to yourself.

[[Go east.|Lost]]
[[Go west.|Lost]]
[[Go north.|Lost]]
[[Go south.|Lost]]

passages.name: Wake
passages.text:
As you groggily regain consciousness sometime later, you look up through your dazed eyes and can't help but feel alarmed by the stranger standing over you with an axe.

[[Defend yourself!|Attack!]]

passages.name: One on one
passages.text:
John comes out of the bedroom visibly irritated, closes the door behind them, and sits opposite you at the table.

[[Wait.|Waiting together]]
[[Drink tea.|Drinking tea together]]

passages.name: Butt
passages.text:
David seems taken aback by your unexpected response. After a few brief moments of awkward silence, he finally responds with a flat "Just do some work."

You proceed to do so.

<<display 'Later'>>

passages.name: Goose!
passages.text:
You quickly duck, narrowly avoiding getting your noggin knocked off by a chair swinging through the air. Moments later, a group of patrons rush to restrain the chair man.

<<display 'Outta here'>>

passages.name: A message
passages.text:
You hear Rachel's phone buzz. She pulls it from her pocket and reads a message.

"It's from a friend I saw at the bar," she reveals. "The guy who went crazy... turns out his card said 'shot through the heart by Bon Jovi.'" <<if $toldRachel = 1>>She looks at you. “How crazy a coincidence is that?”<<endif>>

You pull up outside Rachel's villa. She sighs. "I need some air and gonna go walk down the beach. Want to come along?" she asks.

[["I could do with some air."|Thanks]]
[["I'd rather just drive home."|No thanks]]

passages.name: Stairs
passages.text:
You try to make your way up the stairs, but it seems the current condition of your body isn't up to it. You'll have to stick to low-level tasks.

<<display 'Kitchen'>>

passages.name: Splat
passages.text:
Look up? Ha! You're not falling for it that easily! Unfortunately, it turns out a billboard high above you DOES fall that easily, and straight onto you. As the screams you hear around you slowly fade and your vision begins to blur, you look at the words which ended your life. "Things are looking up!"

THE END

[[What if you had done things differently?|Later]] [[What if you had been bestowed a different fate?|The beginning]]<><>

links.text: What if you had done things differently?
What if you had been bestowed a different fate?

passages.name: Kitchen
passages.text:
<<if $inBedroom eq 1 AND $seePoison eq 1>><<set $returnVar = 1>><<endif>><<if $manWait lt 4 AND $returnVar neq 1>><<if $lookedKitchen eq 0>>You look around the room you're in and find it to be a small, modest kitchen.<<endif>><<if $lookedKitchen eq 1>>You're in a small, modest kitchen.<<endif>> There's a sink with a kettle to its left, a collection of [[drawers|Drawers]] to its right, and a [[cupboard|Cupboard]] below it. A [[pantry|Pantry]] door stands tall in the corner, with a number of [[framed photograghs|Photos]] displayed on the wall next to it. A [[table|Table]] sits at the centre of it all.

[[Stairs|Stairs]] lead up and a door leads [[east|Bedroom]]. Another door leads back [[outside|The door]].

The [[axe|Axe]] remains stuck in the floor.<<set $lookedKitchen = 1>><<endif>><<if $inBedroom eq 1 AND $seePoison eq 1 AND $manWait lt 1>><<display 'Returns'>><<endif>>

passages.name: A slip of paper
passages.text:
You move around to the side of the machine and read the slip of paper:

<<if $lookingUpPlayed eq 1>>[[LOOKING UP|LOOKING UP]]<<endif>><<if $lookingUpPlayed eq 0>>XXXXXXXXXX<<endif>>
<<if $oldAgePlayed eq 1>>[[OLD AGE|OLD AGE]]<<endif>><<if $oldAgePlayed eq 0>>XXXXXXXXXX<<endif>>
<<if $joviPlayed eq 1>>[[SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI|SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI]]<<endif>><<if $joviPlayed eq 0>>XXXXXXXXXX<<endif>>

[[Return your eyes to the mall.|Standing in a mall]]

links.text: SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI

destination.name: SHOT THROUGH THE HEART BY BON JOVI

links.text: Return your eyes to the mall.

passages.name: No thanks
passages.text:
"Are you sure?" she asks, raising a concerned eyebrow. "What about your hands?" You look down and realise they're shaking.

[["Maybe you're right.”|On the beach]]
[["I'll be fine.”|Drive off]]

passages.name: David
passages.text:
David is, as usual, trying to conceal the fact that he's rapidly approaching forty by wearing clothes that belong on a twenty-five year old body. He has styled his hair into a faux hawk despite his obvious receding hairline.

He really does seem all a little too pathetic, but then you remember the infuriating fact that he's your boss.

<<if $meeting eq 1>><<display 'Meeting 1'>><<endif>><<if $meeting eq 2>><<display 'Meeting 2'>><<endif>><<if $meeting eq 1>><<set $meeting = 2>><<endif>>

<<if $meeting lte 2>>[[Look at company logo.|Logo]]
[[Look at your co-workers.|Co-workers]]<<endif>>

passages.name: OLD AGE NOTES
passages.text:
phone is in another building, can ask why he says because ne doesnt like people calling him.

"she's gone now. they're all gone. and soon, you'll be gone too."

limted time after certain actions are performed.

make situation where you're acught snooping, he confronts you and you have to come up with excuses. (i was looking for something warm), he replies snarkily and tells you to get out.

if you dont take bullets and you poison him, he kills you before he dies

after a few talks he says "sorry im not too talkative. been a while since i had company. i'm a little rusty."

if you talk to him more than two times, you get the good ending of him asking about you when help arrives, and him saying that he might start going out and talking to people again

ask why he has gun, tell you he wasnt sure about you, becomes ashamed

why dont you have a phone "because  id ont like company" he says giving you a cold stare.

if you stay in car, it turns into a survival game

heat can with cigarette lighter, make blanket out of something

passages.name: The meeting
passages.text:
Rachel begins to ascend the stairs. "I'm running a little late, sorry! Give me another couple minutes. Bon Jovi will keep you company."

Your eye twitches involuntarily. If The Machine is to be believed, the song Shot Through the Heart by American rock band Bon Jovi will signify your death. And The Machine is always to be believed.

"Here he comes!" Rachel yells from the second floor. You look towards the bottom of the stairs and see a small, ginger Pomeranian waddle down them and towards you.

"Hello," the furry creature says as he looks up at you. "I'm Bon Jovi!"

[["I must be going crazy."|Crazy]]
[["You don't happen to know how to use a gun, do you?"|Doggy with a gun]]
[["Erm, hello. Care to sing one of your classics?"|Sing a song]]
[["Shoo. Go away."|Shoo]]
[["Excuse me."|Excused]]

links.text: "You don't happen to know how to use a gun, do you?"
"Erm, hello. Care to sing one of your classics?"

passages.name: Hell cab
passages.text:
You begin to run across the street and get out your phone. Sadly, you're so distracted with looking up the number that you don't notice the large truck speeding down the street. You were supposed to be a smash hit at the <>meeting<><>interview<>, not on the road!

THE END

[[What if you had done things differently?|Later]] [[What if you had been bestowed a different fate?|The beginning]]<><>

links.text: What if you had done things differently?
What if you had been bestowed a different fate?

passages.name: Ignition
passages.text:
<<if $ignition eq 0>>You push the airbag out of the way and see if the car will start.

It doesn't.<<endif>><<if $ignition eq 1>>You try the ignition again to see if the car has suddenly decided that it wants to start.

It hasn't.<<endif>>

[[Wait.|Wait]]
[[Try using your mobile phone.|Phone]]
[[Try starting the car again.|Ignition]]
[[Go outside.|Outside]]<<if $ignition eq 0>><<set $ignition = 1>><<endif>>

passages.name: Axe
passages.text:
You attempt to pull the axe from the wooden floor, but it's wedged in there good and proper, not to mention that you're not exactly at optimal strength.

<<display 'Kitchen'>>

passages.name: Ignore
passages.text:
You decide to play it cool, and ignore your potential assailant.

You notice everyone else is also ignoring him, which is a bit odd considering his level of fame. You look over to him again and realise it's only a cardboard standee.

Standees don't have much of a history of gun violence, so you relax. You look around and see Rachel beckoning over to her.

Despite your efforts to hide your initial concern, it seems it didn't work quite well enough. "Are you okay?" Rachel asks with a concerned raised eyebrow.

[[Tell her about your death.|Reveal to Rachel]]
[[Say no and sit down at a table with her.|Sit on it]]

links.text: Say no and sit down at a table with her.

passages.name: Run, run
passages.text:
There's still a bus to catch!

All the commotion has held up the traffic, but it won't last. You could try to run down the street and catch up to the bus while it's stalled, or run down the alley to meet with the bus on the next street, though there is the risk of a loading truck blocking your path.

Another thought occurs. You could dash down to a main street while looking up the number of a taxi company in your phone, and arrange for someone to drive you to the building.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 1>>

<<set $timeToGo = 30 - $timePassed>><<if $timeToGo gt 0>>You have <<print $timeToGo>> minutes left!<<endif>><<if $timeToGo eq 0>>You're about to be late!<<endif>><<if $timeToGo lt 0>>You're now <<print $timeToGo>> minutes late!<<endif>>

[[Go down the alley and try to meet the bus at the next street. Fifty-fifty chance of success. (Gain two minutes on success. Lose three on failure)|Up your alley]]
[[Just run down the street! (Two minutes)|Ain't worth it]]
[[Call a cab. (One minute)|Hell cab]]

links.text: Go down the alley and try to meet the bus at the next street. Fifty-fifty chance of success. (Gain two minutes on success. Lose three on failure)
Just run down the street! (Two minutes)

passages.name: Standing in a mall
passages.text:
Peak hour ended an hour or so ago, alleviating the feeling of being a tinned sardine that’s commonly associated with shopping malls, though there are still quite a few people busily bumbling about.

To your left is a [[fast food restaurant|Restaurant]]. To the right is a [[UFO catcher|UFO Catcher]], and a [[poster|Poster]] is hanging on the wall beside it. Behind you is the one of the [[mall's exits|Exit]].

In front of you stands [[the Machine|The Machine]].

<<if $coins gt 0>>You're carrying <<print $coins>> dollars in change.<<endif>><<if $coins eq 0>>You've spent all the loose change you were carrying.<<endif>>

passages.name: Continue meeting
passages.text:
"Brilliant," proclaims one yes man sitting at the table. "Genius," says another. "Groin grabbingly great," yells one who is clearly a little too excited.

"Yes," David booms. "I hope it's not arrogant of me to say that I am the greatest man in the world."

Uneasy laughter breaks out from around the table, no one quite sure if David seriously believed this or not.

"We'll have this slogan plastered on buses and billboards across the city within the month! Any questions? Good. Meeting adjourned!"

[[Leave with everyone else.|Leave meeting]]
[[Reveal your death card to David.|Reveal]]

links.text: Reveal your death card to David.

passages.name: Meeting 1
passages.text:
You're still not sure how you ended up with one of the higher PR positions. The only reason you’re at the company at all is with the insistence and aid of your friend, Hannah, who now runs one of the larger branches in another city.

David is always saying how you should look up to her for inspiration.

"As I was saying, I was unsatisfied with the idiots at the advertising company we were working with, so we bought it and fired everyone," David proclaims with pride.

passages.name: LOOKING UP
passages.text:
You insert your finger, wince slightly at the jab, then pick up and read the card that’s quickly spat out.

LOOKING UP

YEARS LATER...

Oh, crap! Crap, crap, crap! Crappity crappy crap! Poop. You're late for work for the third time this month! Your boss, David, is going to be steamed! You dash out of the elevator and head straight for the meeting room, only to be blocked by a gaggle of co-workers who don't seem to appreciate the gravity of your situation. Between the crowd is Sarah's desk, which she is just about to sit at.<><> [[Dramatically leap over Sarah's desk.|Leap]] [[Dramatically dive under Sarah's desk.|Dive]] [[Calmly move through the crowd and around Sarah's desk.|Calm]]<><><><>

links.text: Calmly move through the crowd and around Sarah's desk.

passages.name: OLD AGE
passages.text:
You insert your finger, wince slightly at the jab, then pick up and read the card that’s quickly spat out.

OLD AGE

YEARS LATER...

It was getting harder to see through the flurry of snow, so much so that you were considering maybe, just maybe, it wasn't such a great idea to go out driving during the worst snowstorm the region has had in over forty years. But hey, you have a schedule to keep, and it's not like anything bad could happen to you. You continue to plow down the road to the best of your ability. Suddenly, a deer appears in your headlights! [[Slam on your brakes!|BREAK]] [[Swerve out of the way!|SWERVE]] [[Screw the deer! Keep on driving!|YOU'RE A TERRIBLE PERSON]]<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><>

links.text: Screw the deer! Keep on driving!

passages.name: Snatched
passages.text:
You take the poison and hide it under your jacket.<<set $getPoison = 1>>

<<display 'Kitchen'>>

passages.name: Bedroom
passages.text:
<<if $manWait eq 0>>You're in a small, musky bedroom. A large double bed covered with a thick blanket is at the end of the room. Next to it is small nightstand with a lamp and [[photograph|Photo]] placed on top of it.

A [[closet|Closet]] is against one wall, with a small table next to it housing a couple [[wigs|Wigs]]. Along the opposite wall is a set of [[drawers|Bedroom drawers]]. Above it sits a [[painting|Painting]].

The door to the kitchen is to the [[west|Kitchen]].<<set $inBedroom = 1>><<endif>><<if $manWait gt 0>>It's probably not a good idea to go poking around the bedroom while John is in there.

<<display 'Returns'>><<endif>>

passages.name: StoryAuthor
passages.text: Hulk Handsome

passages.name: Yes
passages.text:
"Cool," she says, nodding in approval. "It's how I kill time on my lunch break." She munches on a turkey sandwich.


<<display 'Another'>>

passages.name: You first
passages.text:
"Of course."

[["Why do you deathspot?"|Why]]
[["What did your card say?"|Her]]

passages.name: SWERVE
passages.text:
You swerve to avoid the deer, sending your car spinning off the icy roads and straight into a mound of snow with a mighty "VOOMPF!"

Luckily, your head safely hits the quickly inflated airbag and no part of you seems to be seriously injured. Except for maybe your pride.

<<display 'Inside car'>>

passages.name: Suicide
passages.text:
She rolls her eyes. "That's not very fun," she begins. "And also very unoriginal. Be imaginative!" She jams some more turkey in her mouth while pointing at someone else approaching the Machine. "Here's another one."

<<display 'Yet another'>>

passages.name: Her
passages.text:
She finishes eating her lunch before giving an answer. "Turkey sandwich." She looks at her watch. "I'm gonna be late. Maybe I'll see you around." She gives a gentle smile and a weak wave before disappearing among the crowd of people.<<set $chatted = 1>>

[[Return your eyes to the mall.|Standing in a mall]]

links.text: Return your eyes to the mall.

passages.name: No
passages.text: "Heh, sure you're not," she says, shooting a knowing look in your direction. "It's how I kill time on my lunch break." She munches on a turkey sandwich.\n\n<<display 'Another'>>

passages.name: BON JOVI NOTES
passages.text: make the bar fight some kind of boardgame, like SWAHSBUCKLER or ROBORALLY\n\nit seems fights happen in this bar often, because the bottles are made from plastic, but it's still enough to give a good thump and stun you

passages.name: The beginning
passages.text:
MACHINE OF DEATH

Three short stories written and designed by Hulk Handsome. Based on the Machine of Death concept by Ryan North, used with permission. For more information, visit machineofdeath.net.
You check the contents of your shopping basket: bread, milk and alcohol. Well, that's all the essentials, so you pay for your items, and head back out into the mall. On your way to one of the exits, the clinking of change bouncing around your pocket distracts you. Perhaps you should treat yourself to something? You stop walking and take a look around. <><><><><><> <>

passages.text:

passages.name: Poison
passages.text:
You pop open the bottle of poison and pour some in his drink. Hopefully not enough that he will detect it, but still a sufficient amount to have an effect.<<set $poisoned = 1>>

passages.text: <<set $lookingUpPlayed = 0>><<set $oldAgePlayed = 0>><<set $joviPlayed = 0>><<set $lookingUp = 0>><<set $oldAge = 0>><<set $jovi = 0>><<set $firstDeathGiven = 0>><<display 'The beginning'>>

passages.name: Returns
passages.text:
<><><><><><>John returns from outside. He shakes off the snow gathered on him and turns on the kettle. He turns back around to look at you. "They said they'll be ‘ere in about fifteen minutes, so just sit tight," he says moments before the water stops boiling. He gets out two mugs and places a tea bag in each. He places one on the table and hands the other to you. "I'll be back in a minute." He goes into the bedroom and closes the door behind him.

<><>You hear John rummaging around in the next room.

<><>You hear a few things fall to the floor in the next room, followed by John grumbling, "Where the hell are they?"

<><><> [[Wait.|Waiting in the kitchen]] [[Drink tea.|Drink tea]] <>[[Poison his drink.|Poison]]<><>

passages.name: Exit
passages.text:
You turn around and look at the two sliding doors leading to the outside world.

[[You decide to leave.|Leave]]
[[You decide to stay and turn back around.|Standing in a mall]]

links.text: You decide to stay and turn back around.

passages.name: Meeting
passages.text:
You enter the meeting room with a combination of urgency and nonchalance, a fusion that would be entirely impossible under any other circumstances. Your boss, David, stands at the other end of the room. He sends enough daggers your way to supply an assassins' guild for life.

You sit at the table with your co-workers and try to pay attention to the meeting.<<set $meeting = 1>>

[[Look at company logo.|Logo]]
[[Look at your co-workers.|Co-workers]]
[[Look at David.|David]]

passages.name: Doggy with a gun
passages.text:
"I'm a lover, not a fighter!" the pooch proudly proclaims, with a hint of indignation. "I wouldn't even know what to do with a gun if I found one."<>

Both you and Bon Jovi become distracted by Rachel bounding down the stairs with her usual energy.<><> <><>
[["I must be going crazy."|Crazy]]<><>
[["Care to sing one of your classics?"|Sing a song]]<><>
[["Excuse me."|Excused]]<> [["Shoo."|Shoo]]<><><><>

links.text: "Care to sing one of your classics?"

passages.name: Holy crap, I can't believe that worked
passages.text:
You scream and jump and make one hell of a spectacle of yourself.

Astonishingly, it seems to have paid off. The bus comes to a halt at the end of the street, allowing you to catch up and climb aboard. You sit impatiently, watching various buildings go by until it reaches your stop. You hop out and enter the building.

<<display 'Something foyer'>>

passages.name: Cupboard
passages.text:
You rummage through the cupboard under the sink and find what one would expect to find there. A scrubbing brush, a few dirty rags, and so on. <<if $getPoison eq 0>>Then you see a bottle of drain cleaner with a very big poison warning on it.<<set $seePoison = 1>><<endif>>

[[Return your attention to the kitchen.|Kitchen]]
<<if $getPoison eq 0>>[[Take poison.|Snatched]]<html></br></html><<endif>>

links.text: Return your attention to the kitchen.

passages.name: Dive
passages.text:
Your attempt to dive under Sarah's desk fails quite spectacularly, resulting in you smashing your noggin on the edge. You stand up and rest a palm on your throbbing skull.

"Sorry, Sarah."

"It's fine," she replies, trying to contain her laughter as she sits at her desk. "Just get to the meeting."

<<display 'Meeting'>>

passages.name: Pee freely
passages.text:
Ah, sweet relief! You take care of business then march into the appointed room to take care of another kind of business.
<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 2>><<set $didPee = 1>>
<<display 'Showtime!'>>

passages.name: Rank
passages.text:
You opt out of a full shower, and instead settle for a quick rinse around the essential areas. Deodorant takes care of the rest. Or rather, you hope it will.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 4>><<set $showered = 0>>

<<display 'Teeth'>>

passages.name: Phone
passages.text:
<<if $phone eq 0>>Much to your lack of surprise, it appears that the combination of location and weather is getting in the way of phone reception.

You consider playing a round of Irate Fowls but decide it's probably best to conserve battery power.<<endif>><<if $phone eq 1>>You check your phone again to see if the reception situation has changed. 

It hasn't.<<endif>>

[[Wait.|Wait]]
[[Try starting the car.|Ignition]]
[[Go outside.|Outside]]<<set $phone = 1>><<endif>>

passages.name: Making a stool of yourself
passages.text: You plump yourself on one of the barstools and give yourself a spin.\n\n<<display 'The meeting'>>

passages.name: UFO Catcher
passages.text:
<>You wander over to the UFO catcher and peek at what's trapped behind the glass. There doesn't seem to be anything too excit... holy hell! There's a Wee Rex Adorable Plush in there! It looks delightfully cuddly in all it's green glory.<><>You've already won that delightful dinosaur! There's nothing else of interest in the UFO catcher.<><>

Sadly, you have no any remaining change to try to win this dazzling dinosaur.<> <>
[[Jam in a coin and try to win that baby!|Play to win]]<> [[Return your eyes to the mall.|Standing in a mall]]

links.text: Jam in a coin and try to win that baby!
Return your eyes to the mall.

passages.name: Floater
passages.text:
A Pie Floater. An inverted meat pie floating in mushy pea soup, drenched with tomato sauce. These are traditionally sold in vans in the streets of Australian cities, recommended to be eaten whilst standing, and also very, very drunk.
<<if $coins lt 4>><html></br></html>Tragically (or perhaps luckily), you're not carrying enough money to experience this culinary curiosity.<<endif>>
<<if $coins eq 4 OR $coins gt 4>>[[Buy one for four dollars.|Eating a floater]]<<endif>>
[[See what else is on offer.|Menu]]

links.text: See what else is on offer.

passages.name: Ain't worth it
passages.text:
<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 2>>You sprint after the bus and... <<if $timePassed lte 25>>catch up with it! You hop on, and it eventually drops you outside the office.

<<display 'Something foyer'>><<else>>fail to catch up with it!

You could dash down to a main street while looking up the number of a taxi company in your phone, and arrange for someone to drive you to the building. Or just forget about it and move on with your life.

<<endif>>

passages.name: Rumbly tummy

As your feet land on the pavement outside, a terrifying realisation occurs: you forgot to eat anything! You glance down the street and see a Tufo Dog stand.

[[Better than being starving! (Two to three minutes)|Eat eat eat]]
[[Nothing gonna stop my stride! I gotta keep on moving! (One minute)|That song was terrible]]

links.text: Better than being starving! (Two to three minutes)
Nothing gonna stop my stride! I gotta keep on moving! (One minute)

passages.name: Diarroiah
passages.text:
She snorts and begins to laugh. She hunches over, as if she's struggling to breathe for a moment before coughing up some of her sandwich.

"You almost killed me with that joke," she says, a smile on her face. "Would have almost been worth it. Let's see what we can come up for this one!"<<set $poop = 1>>

<<display 'Yet another'>>

passages.name: Time to go
passages.text:
"He's a cutie, isn't he?" she says as she leans down and pets Bon Jovi. "I'm dogsitting him for my friend. She was supposed to come with us tonight." A sudden realisation hits her. "Oh, my friends bailed," she reveals. "But it's okay, we'll either make new friends there or have fun on our own!"

"Time to go!" Rachel announces as she grabs your arm and pulls you outside, where the two of you get in your car.

"You like karaoke, right?" she asks, as you begin to drive to the address she gave you. 

[["Oh my Lordy wordy, yes.”|Sure do]]
[["Erm, not really.”|Not at all]]

passages.name: Card
passages.text: The card reads "POISONED."\n\n<<display 'Bedroom'>>

passages.name: Reveal to Rachel
passages.text:
<<set $toldRachel = 1>>Her eyes widen as you reveal your fate to her. "Why didn't you tell me this earlier?" she exclaims. "This is the worst place for you to be! Almost all of Bon Jovi’s songs are up for singing here! Come on, we'll go somewhere else."

She grabs your arm and pulls you towards the exit.

As you walk by the standee, you both stop in your tracks as a familiar melody flows from the speakers, and turn to the stage to see a middle-aged businessman begin to belt out the most terrifying words you could ever hear.

"Shot... through the heart... it's all part... of the game that we call love!"

<<display 'Not over until the chiselled rocker sings'>>

destination.name: Not over until the chiselled rocker sings

passages.name: Sofahh
passages.text:
You pick a sofa from the wide selection and plump yourself down on it. It feels like real leather.

<<display 'The meeting'>>

passages.name: Reflection
passages.text:
Are you happy? Is this what you want to do? If you didn't avoid that sign, would you be satisfied with how your life had turned out?

Sure, you're good at your job and it pays well, but is that all you want from work? 

If not, maybe it's time for a change.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 2>><<set $reflected = 1>>

[[Screw it. I'm going to find a new life right now. It's not going to be easy, but it's what I want.|Gone home]]
[[Maybe one day. But I'm satisfied right now, and I have bills to pay. Keep on going. (One minute)|Run, run]]

links.text: Screw it. I'm going to find a new life right now. It's not going to be easy, but it's what I want.
Maybe one day. But I'm satisfied right now, and I have bills to pay. Keep on going. (One minute)

passages.name: Gotten me killed
passages.text:
"How the hell was I supposed to know that would happen?" she protests. "I said I was sorry!" She angrily stares out the window. “Don’t you think I feel awful enough as it is?”

<<display 'A message'>>

passages.name: Stealth eater
passages.text: You carefully consume the tofu dog, ensuring nothing drips onto you, and so that you can savour that sweet, sweet tastelessness.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 3>><<set $cleanEat = 1>>\n\n<<display 'Busted'>>

destination.name: What a rotten way to die

passages.name: Nothing to hide
passages.text:
Rachel hops into the passenger seat and immediately notices the gun. "What the hell is that?" she asks, her voice laced with fear. Before you can even explain, she gets out of the car. "Stay the hell away from me!" she blurts as she disappears into the crowd emerging from the bar. You begin the long drive home. To break the silence, you turn the radio on. "Shot... through the heart... it's all part... of the game that we call love!"

THE END

passages.name: Gun
passages.text:
You take the gun out of your glove box and, to feel like an action hero, stuff it down the back of your pants, sliding your top over it to hide it from vision.<<set $gun = 1>>

<<display 'Bar'>>

passages.name: Outta here
passages.text:
You feel someone grab your arm, and look over to see that it’s Rachel. "Let's get out of here," she says while motioning towards the exit.

You charge out of the bar and leap back into your car, adrenaline still pumping through your veins. As you slam the door, the glove box pops open and reveals your gun.

[[Grab it and hide it in your jacket before Rachel can see it.|See no evil]]
[[Leave it.|Nothing to hide]]

links.text: Grab it and hide it in your jacket before Rachel can see it.

passages.name: The drive home
passages.text:
Rachel hops into the passenger seat and buckles up. 

Rachel is the first to break the brief silence as you drive back to her villa. "That was crazy," she begins. "I'm so sorry."

[["You couldn't have known that would happen."|Couldn't have known]]
[["You could have gotten me killed!"|Gotten me killed]]

links.text: "You couldn't have known that would happen."

passages.text:

You get back up and look at the billboard. "Things are looking up!" it happily proclaims. 

You really hate that slogan.

You stride into the foyer, only for your swagger to stagger when you suddenly realise that you need to pee.

passages.name: BREAK
passages.text:
You slam on the breaks, sending your car spinning off the icy roads and straight into a mound of snow with a mighty "VOOMPF!"

Luckily, your head safely hits the quickly inflated airbag and no part of you seems to be seriously injured. Except for maybe your pride.

<<display 'Inside car'>>

passages.name: Meeting 2
passages.text:
David continues his spiel. "My first move as the CEO was to come up with an incredibly clever slogan for Albatross Airway’s new marketing campaign. And here it is..."

He pulls a sheet from over a display, revealing a large piece of cardboard baring the words "Things are looking up!"

Your eye twitches involuntarily.

"It has a double meaning," David begins, his voice laced with excitement. "Not only is it informing our customers that the recession is over and that it's safe to spend money on travelling again, but to also look to our planes in the sky as an escape!" He strikes what he must believe to be a heroic pose. "Quite clever, I'm sure you'll agree."

The room bursts into applause and cheers.

[[Applause with the crowd.|Continue meeting]]
[[Tap your finger on the desk nervously.|Continue meeting]]
[[Do nothing.|Continue meeting]]<<set $meeting = 3>>

links.text: Tap your finger on the desk nervously.

passages.text:
"I went crazy once," he admits with a hint of shame. "I believed I was a Pomeranian."<>

Before you have time to finish this enlightening conversation, Rachel bounds down the stairs with her usual energy.<> <>[["But you are a Pomeranian!"|The hard truth]]<>
[["You don't happen to know how to use a gun, do you?"|Doggy with a gun]]<><>

passages.name: Duck
passages.text:
You duck to the ground and hide behind a table! You then look over to Jon Bon Jovi and realise it's only a cardboard standee.

Rachel laughs. "What are you doing? You haven't even had anything to drink yet!"

[[Tell her about your death.|Reveal to Rachel]]
[[Apologise and sit down at a table with her.|Sit on it]]

links.text: Apologise and sit down at a table with her.

passages.name: TIME TRAVEL MISHAP
passages.text:
time-travel mishap, you see yourself die and try to stop it but destory universe, let it happen or go back and set it up to kill yourself. your friend sends you to try and save him, turns out he killed you? you go back in time and kill him before he kills you, send you in a loop because of paradox

use laser weapon in time travle story to avoid over using guns

you can refuse to fix the paradox and let the universe cease to exists, or kill guy at wrong time which sends everything backwards since it couldnt have happened, or you can choose to kill yourself

don't worry, i'm happy. we had a really good run, you and I.
straight to the point. you remind me of me when i was your age.

had did

passages.name: Sure do
passages.text:
"Great! Because that's exactly where we're going." A huge smile conquers her face. "It's one of my favourite places in the world.”

<<display 'Outside the karaoke bar'>>

passages.name: Not this time
passages.text:
You scream and jump and make one hell of a spectacle of yourself.

Unsurprisingly, it doesn't pay off. The bus continues on its merry way despite your self-humiliation.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 2>>

<<display 'Streets'>>

passages.name: Sir
passages.text: "Yes, Sir," you reply. David nods. "Good to know. Now, go do some work."\n\n<<display 'Later'>>

passages.name: Killing time
passages.text: You sit silently at the table with your accidental companion. A strong wind beats against the walls outside.\n\n<<display 'Time to talk'>>

passages.name: Showtime!
passages.text:
SO HOW DID YOU DO?

<> <>You showered, and blessed the room with a fruity aroma.<><>You didn't shower, and cursed the room with a pungent funk.<> <>You brushed your teeth, and showed off your winning smile.<><>You didn't brush your teeth, and made the panel wince every time you smiled.<> <>You dressed to impress, and impress you did.<><>The panel looked at your messy outfit with disapproving eyes.<> <>You ate some food and thus wasn't distracted by hunger.<><>You didn't eat food, and kept getting distracted by a rumbling stomach.<><><>

You took care while eating, making sure not to leave any unsightly stains for the panel to see.<><>

You didn't take care while eating, and can't help but wonder if the panel noticed the chutney stain.<><> <>You took time to reflect after your near-death experience, leaving you confident.<><>You didn't pause for reflection after your near-death experience, leaving you noticeably shaken.<> <>You used the toilet, forbidding your bladder from distracting you.<><>You held your pee the entire time, causing you to squirm in your seat.<> <>You weren't late! Punctuality is always impressive.<><><>You were late for the important date!<> <><>Despite the hiccups, you manage to impress the panel and return to your office with a signed contract. Congratulations!<><> Despite the hiccups, the interview ended with you getting offered a job. Congratulations!<><><>All these hiccups lead to one grand disaster. You leave the office without a signed contract, and soon you will be without a career. <><> All these hiccups lead to one grand disaster. You leave the office with no job and with no idea of what you’ll do now. <><>

THE END

passages.text:
<<if $wentOut eq 0>>You bundle yourself up as much as you can and step out of the car. As suspected, it is cold. Very cold. Snow storms around you.<<endif>><<if $wentOut eq 1>>You head back out into the freezing cold.<<endif>><<set $wentOut = 1>>

passages.name: Calm
passages.text:
"Excuse me," you say with the utmost politeness as you gently carve your way through the congregation of co-workers.

"Good morning, Sarah," you say, while giving her a nod as she sits at her desk. "Good morning," she replies. "The meeting has already started. You better get a move on if you don't want David to bite your head off."

You ponder this thought and increase your pace after deciding that you like your head where it is, perched perfectly atop your neck.

<<display 'Meeting'>>

passages.name: Not at all
passages.text:
"Oh," she says as the smile leaves her face. "Well, then you can get drunk while you listen to me sing! But if you get bored we'll go somewhere else." A smile returns. "We'll have fun one way or another."

<<display 'Outside the karaoke bar'>>

passages.name: Winning smile
passages.text: Not only do you give your teeth a good brushing, you also give your tongue a rub down, because that's what commercials say you have to do these days.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 2>><<set $brushedTeeth = 1>>\n\n<<display 'Dressing time'>>

passages.name: Attack!
passages.text:
You leap to your feet, adrenaline helping you ignore the pain surging through every inch of your body. You slam your entire weight as hard as you can against your potential assassin, knocking him backwards and prompting him to drop the axe, which falls blade first into the wooden planks of the floor with a thunk.

"What the hell are you doing here?" You look at the source of the voice and get your first clear look at the axe wielder, and see that it's an elderly man, maybe in his early 70s, though looking surprisingly fit for his apparent age. He's standing behind a chair, both hands gripped tightly on the back as if he's prepared to use it as a weapon.

[[Explain your situation.|Explain]]
[[Ask why the hell he had an axe.|Axe to grind]]

links.text: Ask why the hell he had an axe.

passages.name: Sing a song
passages.text:
"This isn't a dog and pony show!" He pauses, perhaps for dramatic effect, and then bursts into song and dance. You recognise the tune as the early 90s hit, I'll Sleep When I'm Dead. He yawns and lies down on the floor after his energetic performance. "Actually, I'm getting pretty sleepy now."<>

Both you and Bon Jovi become distracted by Rachel bounding down the stairs with her usual energy.<><> <><>
[["I must be going crazy."|Crazy]]<><>
[["You don't happen to know how to use a gun, do you?"|Doggy with a gun]]<><>
[["Excuse me."|Excused]]<> [["Shoo."|Shoo]]<><>

links.text: "You don't happen to know how to use a gun, do you?"

passages.name: Nights
passages.text:
She sighs. "I'm really not that crazy. I mean, maybe when I was a bored teen with too much money. But now I just feel worn out." She stares at the sand.

"This was the first time I've been out in a while." She looks over to you. "Maybe I felt I had to take you there because of my reputation. I mean, I still love the place and had so many good times there, but..." she trails off and looks out towards the ocean.

"I'm going to go let Bonny have a run," she eventually says. <<if $toldRachel = 1>>You better be careful around him," she adds with a mischievous grin. <<endif>>"We'll be right back."

<<display 'The choice'>>

passages.name: Poster
passages.text:
The poster is advertising the upcoming tour of stand-up comedian Phil Bison, also known as the Cancer Comic.

Before the Machine hit, jokes about fatal illnesses were considered “edgy” and politically incorrect, often leading to controversy. Now they’re as common as knock, knock jokes.

Of course, modern comedians only get away with it because of their slips. As his stage name suggests, Bison received one of the more straight forward machine results: CANCER. It doesn’t take a genius to figure out what themes he explores with his humour.

Some are of the opinion that it’s healthy for people to laugh at their own tragedies, believing it’s a valuable coping mechanism. Others accuse it of being exploitive.

It doesn't help that there was once a comedian who "faked his own death," claiming he was going to die from an HIV infection. At the height of his fame, he was constantly surrounded by people, something he seemed to treasure. When it was discovered he lied about his death, his career was instantly destroyed.

His slip actually said ISOLATION.

[[Return your eyes to the mall.|Standing in a mall]]

links.text: Return your eyes to the mall.

passages.name: YOU'RE A TERRIBLE PERSON
passages.text:
Fuck nature! What has it ever done for you? You press your foot down on the accelerator and slam into the deer with a great thump.

If deer could laugh, it would have had the last one. The impact sends your car spinning off the icy roads and straight into a mound of snow with a mighty "VOOMPF!"

Luckily, your head safely hits the quickly inflated airbag and no part of you seems to be seriously injured. Except for maybe your pride.

<<display 'Inside car'>>

passages.name: Restaurant
passages.text:
The restaurant is a Deady's, a fast food chain that quickly cropped up across the world after the Machine became an international pop sensation.

Their slogan is “You Only Live Once!” which, when translated from marketing speak and into English, basically means “You know how you’re going to die, so until then you may as well enjoy yourself by clogging your arteries with as much of our disgustingly/deliciously unhealthy food as possible.”

People who pulled FOOD PIOSONING from the Machine receive a card that gives them a permanent 5% discount. Well, after they sign a waiver, that is.

You take a look at some of the menu “highlights.”

<<display 'Menu'>>

passages.name: Knocked his block off!
passages.text:
You grab Jovi and hold him out in front of you at arm’s length. The man stares at it with menace in his eyes, snarling "You." 

He swings at the standee, knocking the head clean off Jon Bon Jovi's shoulders, moments before a group of patrons rush to restrain the chair man.

<<display 'Outta here'>>

passages.name: Photos
passages.text:
You examine the framed photographs hanging on the wall.

The first is of a middle-aged blonde woman, smiling as she rests a hand on the side of a hazel horse.

The second appears to be a photo of John, albeit when he was a couple decades younger, proudly holding a large fish.

<<display 'Kitchen'>>

passages.name: Meaning
passages.text:
"It means nothing!" David answers, almost bringing the ceiling down due to him neglecting his inside voice. "Do you think I would have become the person I am today if I let my death hold me back? No!" He slams his hand on the table to prove just how serious he is.

"I ignored it and built this company out of nothing but my blood, sweat, tears, and a large inheritance from my grandparents! You’re card is nothing but a coincidence. You'll have to deal with it."

[["No. I quit."|Quit]]
[[Leave the room and go to your desk.|Leave meeting]]

links.text: Leave the room and go to your desk.

passages.name: Dismantle and dispose
passages.text:
You carefully take apart the gun, throw a couple pieces into the ocean, and store the rest about your person to dump elsewhere. You hear the scampering of little feet behind you and turn to see Bon Jovi joyously run to the shore, playfully running towards and away from the waves as they move in and out before he comes up to you. "Hello, Bon Jovi," you say. "Wuff!" he responds. You crouch down and give him a pat without a second thought. It feels good to be in control of your fear. After all, it's your life. It's now or never. You ain't gonna live forever. You just want to live while you're alive.

THE END

[[What if you had done things differently?|Outside the karaoke bar]] [[What if you had been bestowed a different fate?|The beginning]]

links.text: What if you had done things differently?
What if you had been bestowed a different fate?

passages.name: Blood
passages.text:
He looks down at the table. "I s'pose I didn't do a great job hiding the stains." He lifts up the cloth and peeks under it for a moment. "I used to fish a lot. One day I came home and there were too many dishes on the sink, so I just did the filletin' on the table. Turned out it stained more than I thought it would."

"Sarah really let me have it that night." A grin cracks across his face.

<<set $sarah = 1>><<display 'Time to talk'>>

passages.name: Drive off
passages.text:
Rachel waves goodbye as you begin the long drive home. After a few minutes, you turn the radio on to break the silence. "Shot... through the heart... it's all part... of the game that we call love!"

THE END

[[What if you had done things differently?|Outside the karaoke bar]] [[What if you had been bestowed a different fate?|The beginning]]
