What if you had been bestowed a different fate?

passages.name: Ask
passages.text: She raises an eyebrow at you. "You know, watching how people react to their tickets and trying to guess their deaths." She begins to munch on a turkey sandwich. "It's how I kill time on my lunch break." \n\n<<display 'Another'>>

passages.name: A cold kitchen
passages.text: <<set $oldAge = 1>><<set $oldAgePlayed = 1>><<set $phone = 0>><<set $carWait = 0>><<set $car = 0>><<set $ignition = 0>><<set $wentOut = 0>><<set $lost = 0>><<set $axeAsk = 0>><<set $seePoison = 0>><<set $getPoison = 0>><<set $poisonCount = 0>><<set $poisoned = 0>><<set $inBedroom = 0>><<set $manWait = 0>><<set $lookCloth = 0>><<set $lookedKitchen = 0>><<set $getBullets = 0>><<set $waitingForHelp = 0>><<set $sarah = 0>><<set $askLooking = 0>><<display 'Kitchen'>>\n

passages.name: Why
passages.text:
She shrugs. "It's fun watching how people react. To see what it says about them and the lives they've lived, and the life they'll live from that point. It gets me to look back at my own life, too. To reflect or whatever." She chews her sandwich some more. <<if $poop eq 1>>"Also, sometimes I meet people who think explosive diarroiah can be a cause of death."<<endif>>

[["What did your slip say?"|Her]]

passages.name: AB
passages.text:
An A.B. A bed of thick fries, with a load of marinated lamb dumped on top, which is then smothered with cheese and chilli sauce.
<<if $coins lt 5>><html></br></html>Tragically (or perhaps luckily), you're not carrying enough money to experience this culinary curiosity.<<endif>>
<<if $coins eq 5 OR $coins gt 5>>[[Buy one for five dollars.|Eating an A.B.]]<<endif>>
[[See what else is on offer.|Menu]]

links.text: See what else is on offer.

passages.name: Lost
passages.text:
<<if $lost eq 0>>You head into what you believe is the right direction, but really you have no idea of knowing. 

If you were anyone else, you may be a little worried right about now. But not you. You know how you're going to die, and it's not hypothermia. Hell, you could be naked right now and still survive. Maybe... maybe you SHOULD get naked?

No. No, that is not a good idea.

[[Go east.|Lost]]
[[Go west.|Lost]]
[[Go north.|Lost]]
[[Go south.|Lost]]<<endif>><<if $lost eq 1>>You trudge through the snow some more, likely just getting yourself more lost than before.

You feel yourself constantly shivering and becoming a little drowsy. 

Nothing to worry about.

[[Go east.|Lost]]
[[Go west.|Lost]]
[[Go north.|Lost]]
[[Go south.|Lost]]<<endif>><<if $lost eq 2>>You stumble over your next few steps and feel your breathing start to slow. It may be time to admit that you should be worried.

But The Machine is never wrong! It said old age!

[[Stumble this way.|Lost]]
[[Stumble that way.|Lost]]<<endif>><<if $lost eq 3>>As you continue to make your way through the snow, a growing hatred of The Machine powers you on.

[[Stagger this way.|Lost]]
[[Stagger that way.|Lost]]<<endif>><<if $lost eq 4>>You push forward, fighting the cold, your body on the verge of completely shutting down.

Then, in the distance, you see a light.

[[Go towards the light.|There's a light]]<<endif>><<set $lost = $lost + 1>>

passages.name: Later
passages.text:
ONE MONTH LATER

You're startled awake by the sounds of car horns outside. You yawn and reach over to your beside table to check the time<>, accidentally knocking your Wee Rex Adorable Plush to the floor in the process<>. CRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAP! You overslept again! Really, you should buy an alarm clock that functions correctly, but the pizza stains on this one hold sentimental value. Now you only have thirty minutes <>to meet the potential new clients you've been sent to woo. If you screw this up, your career at Albatross Airways is out the window like... an albatross flying out a window.<><>to get to your job interview and knock the socks off the Ruby Blue Airways head honchos!<> Time to get ready in record time, while still being half-presentable! [[Have a brisk, yet thorough shower. (Seven minutes)|So clean]] [[Cleanliness is overrated! Settle for a quick rinse. (Four minutes)|Rank]]<><><>

links.text: Have a brisk, yet thorough shower. (Seven minutes)
Cleanliness is overrated! Settle for a quick rinse. (Four minutes)

passages.name: No pee for me!
passages.text: No time for such trivial things as bodily functions! You strut into the appointed room.\n<<display 'Showtime!'>>\n

passages.name: Drawers
passages.text: You search through the drawers. They're mostly empty aside from a few blunt utensils. Pointless discoveries.\n\n<<display 'Kitchen'>>

passages.name: Gun grab
passages.text:
You remember the gun hidden in your pants, but it seems it wasn't hidden enough. The crazed man sees it under your shirt and grabs it before you can stop him.

He waves it wildly in the air! "Turn the music off!" he screams. "I'm not ready yet!"

[[Use Bon Jovi as a shield!|Did you forget he's not real?]]
[[Duck! DUCK!|Your goose is cooked!]]
[[Try to wrestle the gun back off him!|Wrestle]]

links.text: Use Bon Jovi as a shield!

destination.name: Did you forget he's not real?

links.text: Try to wrestle the gun back off him!

passages.name: The Machine
passages.text:
You approach The Machine, which has the very charming street name of The Machine of Death.

The device has only been around for a few years, but it's already hard to imagine a world without it, as it completely reshaped it, creating a culture of death. Well, others feel that it created a culture of life, despite it clearly ruining a few people's.
<<if $machine eq 0>><html></br></html>Here's how it works: a person inserts a dollar and sticks their finger in the machine, which takes a blood sample. A little card is then spat out, which reveals the persons final fate.

Of course, it's not that simple. The machine is always 100% accurate, but the cards are often obtuse and even misleading, such as the tragic person who recieved PEANUTS, spent years avoiding the faux nut, only to have a box full of Snoopy comics fall on top of and kill them. 

Events like this have led some to believe that the machine has a sense of humour.<html></br></html><<endif>>
You never did get yourself tested. <<if $coins eq 0>>And it looks like you won't be doing it today, as you're out of change.<<endif>>
<<if $coins gt 0>><html></br></html>Maybe today is the day. 

[[Insert a coin.|Death]]<<endif>>
[[Stand back and watch people use the Machine.|Watch]]
[[A slip of paper is stuck to the side of the Machine. Examine it.|A slip of paper]]
[[Return your eyes to the mall.|Standing in a mall]]<<set $machine = 1>>

links.text: Stand back and watch people use the Machine.
A slip of paper is stuck to the side of the Machine. Examine it.
Return your eyes to the mall.

passages.name: Co-workers
passages.text:
You look at your co-workers. Their wide, emotionless eyes are fixated on David, each of their faces infected with a hideous grin stretching across them.

Will you one day become like them?

<<if $meeting eq 1>><<display 'Meeting 1'>><<endif>><<if $meeting eq 2>><<display 'Meeting 2'>><<endif>><<if $meeting eq 1>><<set $meeting = 2>><<endif>>

<<if $meeting lte 2>>[[Look at company logo.|Logo]]
[[Look at David.|David]]<<endif>>

passages.name: Logo
passages.text:
You look at the company logo hanging on the far wall. It states the company's name, Albatross Airways, in large blue letters. Above it is a picture depicting a giant albatross surfing a plane. Or perhaps it's a regular-sized albatross surfing a tiny plane?

<<if $meeting eq 1>><<display 'Meeting 1'>><<endif>><<if $meeting eq 2>><<display 'Meeting 2'>><<endif>><<if $meeting eq 1>><<set $meeting = 2>><<endif>>

<<if $meeting lte 2>>[[Look at your co-workers.|Co-workers]]
[[Look at David.|David]]<<endif>>

passages.name: Drink tea
passages.text: You sip some of the hot tea.\n\n<<display 'Returns'>>

passages.name: Why the dive?
passages.text:
"It makes me feel normal," she admits. "Not that I'm as weird as everyone says. But people treat me differently because I have lots of money." She stares at the ground.

"I don't mean to 'slum it,' and I know how damn lucky I am; that's why I try to volunteer a lot. But sometimes I just want to forget about it all and let go."

"Besides, I love to sing even if not everyone loves hearing me," she says with a laugh. "I'm going to go let Bonny have a run. <<if $toldRachel = 1>>You better be careful around him," she adds with a mischievous grin. <<endif>>"We'll be right back."

<<display 'The choice'>>

passages.name: Brunette
passages.text:
The colour of this wig is that of a dark brunette, and is rough to touch. The hair is fairly short. Underneath the wig stand is a label that reads "Henry."

[[Examine the blonde wig.|Blonde]]
[[Examine the rest of the bedroom.|Bedroom]]

links.text: Examine the rest of the bedroom.

passages.name: Life after Sarah
passages.text:
"Poisoning, just like that damn Machine said. Accidental. I’m only consoled knowing it was painless and that she still ‘ad a long life."

He pauses. "I ‘aven’t been out much since then. Been nice to talk to someone again. Maybe you're a sign from Sarah that I need to keep on livin' while I'm here."

<<display 'Time to talk'>>

passages.name: Fuck
passages.text:
"Go fuck yourself," you mumble under the breath. "Hahaha! I would if I could!" replies David. "Also, you're fired. Don't let the door hit you on the way out, because I don't want ass prints on my door."<<set $fired = 1>>

<<display 'Later'>>

passages.name: Pantry
passages.text:
You open the pantry door, switch on the light, and gaze at the contents within.

It's quite bare. Tubs of flour and sugar, a few boxed and canned goods, and sacks of vegetables on the floor.

<<display 'Kitchen'>>

passages.name: Another
passages.text:
"Take that last guy. He seemed pretty relieved when he looked at his ticket. I'm going to guess that he's been feeling a burning sensation when peeing lately." She giggles gleefully to herself.

The machine is often used as a self-diagnosing tool. Instead of going to a doctor, they would just get a jabbed to see if they were suffering from anything serious. This practice was naturally met with much disapproval from medical professionals.

"Check it out, here comes some more," she says as she chews on her sandwich.

A group of teenagers approach the machine with jovial spirits, egging one of their friends on to get jabbed, then cheer deafeningly as he does so. He pulls out a slip and they all begin to laugh, the jabbed laughing as he seemingly mimes his own head exploding.

"So," the deathspotter asks before taking another bite of her sandwich, "What do you think he got?"

[["Suicide."|Suicide]]
[["Explosive diarroiah."|Diarroiah]]
[["I'm not interested."|Uninterested]]

passages.name: Sit on it
passages.text:
She smiles, though a quizzical expression remains on her face.

"Well, try to relax and enjoy yourself. I'm supposed to be the crazy one, remember?"

As you walk by the standee towards a table, you stop in your tracks as a familiar melody flows from the speakers. You turn to the stage to see a middle-aged businessman begin to belt out the most terrifying words you could ever here.

"Shot... through the heart... it's all part... of the game that we call love!"

<<display 'Not over until the chiselled rocker sings'>>

destination.name: Not over until the chiselled rocker sings

passages.name: Yet another
passages.text:
A middle-aged woman approaches the machine and gets her finger jabbed. She hesitates before reading her slip, finally relenting and peering at the uppercase letters that will set her fate in stone. She begins to cry.

After a brief moment of silence, the nameless deathspotter speaks. "Let's not guess that one. This can be a depressing hobby sometimes." She nibbles her turkey sandwich a little more and turns to you. "So, have you been jabbed?"

[["None of your business."|Uninterested]]
[["No."|Unjabbed]]
[["Have you?"|You first]]

passages.name: Unjabbed
passages.text:
"Well, careful if you do it. It can change the way you live life. And usually not in a good way."

[["Why do you deathspot?"|Why]]
[["What did your slip say?"|Her]]

passages.name: Sloppy eater
passages.text: No time to lose! You cram the tofu dog in your mouth as you dash down the street, drops of mango chutney dripping over you. Goodness, you can't take yourself anywhere!<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 2>><<set $cleanEat = 0>>\n\n<<display 'Busted'>>

passages.name: Leave meeting
passages.text:
As you go for the door, you hear David calling your name. 

"Just one thing before you go," he begins. "If you're ever late again, I'll kick your ass so hard that you'll be able to build a pool in the footprint."

It's hard to tell if he's trying to be humourous or not.

[["Yes, Sir."|Sir]]
[["Go fuck yourself."|Fuck]]
[["Are you saying I have a big butt?"|Butt]]

links.text: "Are you saying I have a big butt?"

passages.name: Floordrobe
passages.text:
You find the least stain covered outfit among your floordrobe and slip it on. You have a quick whiff and decide it would be best to drown the garment in deodorant.<<set $timePassed = $timePassed + 3>><<set $dressedWell = 0>>

<<display 'Rumbly tummy'>>

passages.name: The door
passages.text: You consider going outside and risking the cold weather again despite your current state, but though The Machine has never been wrong before, you certainly don't want to be the first person to prove that it's not infallible.\n\n<<display 'Kitchen'>>
